intro: Dischidanthus, commonly known as the silver bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their dense, silver-green foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Dischidanthus species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements. Their unique appearance and adaptability make them popular choices for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
